New Records: Emilio Nsue became the oldest player to score five or more goals in an AFCON at the age of 34.
Jose Machin became one of only three players to provide an assist in three consecutive AFCON matches.
Key Match Events: Bikoro scored the winning goal for Equatorial Guinea in the 55th minute.
Bayo scored a late goal for Guinea in the 90+8' minute.
Jeanvier was given a yellow card in the 41st minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Equatorial Guinea have now reached the knockout stage in each of the last four AFCON competitions they have featured in (2012, 2015, 2021 and 2023).

Guinea have suffered defeat in their last six AFCON knockout games and failed to score in the last four, including their round-of-16 clashes in 2019 (3-0 against Algeria) and 2021 (1-0 against Gambia).
Post-Match Reflections: With the exception of Senegal and Morocco, Equatorial Guinea were possibly the most impressive team in the group stages of the competition and have the chance to send out a clear message to the big hitters remaining in the competition with a victory in this one.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will mark the first time that Guinea faces this opponent, and it could turn out to be a titanic first meeting between two sides that are separated by just eight places in the FIFA world rankings, with Guinea currently ranked 80th and Equatorial Guinea placed 88th.
Others: The winner of this match will progress to the last eight, where they will face either the seven-time champions Egypt or two-time winners Congo DR on February 2 at this venue.
